column3: Please state your name and pronouns (for acknowledgement purposes, both optional)
column4: Please add your social media handle (e.g. Twitter @Alice, Instagram @Alice)
column5: Please choose a (1-3) word category for your question
column6: Please write your question here
column7: Please write the answer to your question here
column8: Are you 18 years old or younger? (For prize category)

column6: Which woman scientist and polymath wrote 'The Connexion of the Physical Sciences' published in 1835?
In 2019, who was the first black woman to receive a PhD in physics from the University of Glasgow?
Which mathematician, when exiting a taxi, noted that 1729 is the smallest number that can be expressed by the sum of two cubes in two different ways?

In 1945 the Royal Society elected the first two female fellows. With three letters: first being their scientific field and the other two their initials work out who they were and what they did. ‘CKL’ ‘BMS’
column7: Crystallography Kathleen Lonsdale Biochemistry Marjory Stephenson

column6: Described on a marble monument at Westminster Abbey as ‘This Dutches was a wise wittie & learned lady, which her many Bookes do well testifie’, who was the first woman to visit the Royal Society in 1667?
Finding her first comet on 1st August  1786, then going on to discover 7 more, who was Britains first professional female scientist? In 1787 she received her first pension from the king (£50).
Which book warned the world of the dangers of modern synthetic pesticides? It was written by US naturalist Rachel Carson.
In which century and decade did Émilie du Châtelet translate Isaac Newton’s Principia Mathematica? It still remains the standard version.
The Hungarian mathematician Vera Sos has an Erdos number of what?
Which Indian physicist, through an equation that bears his name, demonstrated that the elements in stars are ionised in proportion to their temperature?
Maria Gaetana Agnesi was an 18th century Italian mathematician and scholar. The cubic curve was named in her honour, what famous name was given to this curve ?
Cecilia Payne-Gaposchkin, in her 1925 doctoral thesis, correctly proposed that stars were composed primarily of what two elements?
Ben A. Barres (1954 - 2017) was an American neurobiologist at what American university? In 2013 he became the first openly transgender scientist in the National Academy of Scientists.

What nickname was given to Sara Josephine Baker (1873 - 1945), an American physician notable for making contributions to public health in New York, when she worked for the Department of Health? She frequently wore masculine-tailored suits.
Trailblazing: The True Story of America's First Openly Gay Track Coach (2000) was an autobiography of which American Sociologist? He currently is a professor at the University of Winchester.
In 2019 (March) Emma Haruka Iwao calculated the most accurate value of which mathematical constant ?
An experiment to test a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behaviour was named after which famous British gay mathematician?
Alan Turing published "The Chemical Basis of ____ (19_2)". What is the missing word and decade?

In Dragon Ball Z (anime) who is the Daughter of Dr. Briefs, the founder of the Capsule Corporation? She is a scientific genius, inventor, and engineer. She invented the Dragon radar, a device that detects Dragon balls.
Mary Jackson Winston (1921 - 2005) was an African American mathematician and aerospace engineer. In 1958 she became NASA's first black female engineer. In what film did Janellle Monae play her ?
In physics Noether's theorem states what?
column7: For every symmetry there is a corresponding conservation law.

column6: Who discovered the structure of insulin?
In what year did Mary Anning discover the ichthyosaur skeleton?
Muthayya Vanitha is the project director of which mission, described as the first Indian Space Research Organisation mission to be led by women?
column7: Chandrayaan-2, India’s second lunar exploration mission

column6: E. Latunde Odeku was the first Aftican neurosurgeon trained in the US, which African nation is he from ?
George McJunkin was an African-American cowboy, and amateur archaeologist, who discovered ancient remains of which type of animal in 1908 near Folsom, New Mexico?
Barbara McClintock (1902-1992) was a US plant geneticist who discovered certain types of genes commonly referred to as what? The function of these genes is to control other genes.

Who am I? From 1974-92 I directed the Medical Research Council’s Mammalian development unit in London. I mainly worked in embryology and using mice. In 1991 I became the Royal society’s foreign secretary.

A copy of ‘Conversations on Chemistry’ (1805) was left at the bookbinder where Faraday was an apprentice, he credited the author of the book with the start of his interest in chemistry. Who was the author?

Who was the first African-American woman to receive a United States patent ? Her patent was issued for the invention of the cabin bed. A STEM academy was opened in her honor on the south side of Chicago.
Edward Bouchet (1852 - 1918) is the first African-American to receive a PhD in any subject. What science did Bouchet get his PhD in?
James Sylvester Gates Jr. is an American theoretical physicist who works on ____ symmetry, ______gravity, and _____string theory. What is the missing word?
Who was born on January 8th, 1942, on the 300th anniversary of Galileo's death? They died on March 14th, 2018, on the anniversary of Albert Einstein's birth.
column7: Which physicist was born on January 8th, 1942, on the 300th anniversary of Galileo's death? They died on March 14th, 2018, on the anniversary of Albert Einstein's birth.

column6: HeLa cells were first sourced from whom?
To the nearest percent, what percentage of articles on wikipedia are of women ?
LGBTQIA+ stands for what?
column7: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans, Queer, Intersex, Asexuality, + (Other)

column6: Which British, 20th century physicist predicted the existence of anti-matter?
In 1856, which scientist first theorised that CO2 emissions may have a warming effect on the climate thus predicting the global heating that we see today?
Edward Bouchet was the first african-american to earn a phd in Physics from an american university, in which year did he graduate from Yale?
Who's theorem explains the connection between symmetry and conservation laws and was described by contemporaries as the most important woman in the history of mathematics?
Which canadian shared the Nobel prize for generating high-intensity, ultra-short optical pulses?
Who was the first woman to win the Nobel prize in Physiology or medicine in 1947?
Which WWI field radiographer went on to win the Nobel Prize for producing the first artificially created radioactive atoms  in 1935?
Who won the 2015 Nobel prize for medicine for their pioneering work on malaria?
Which Hollywood star patented a frequency-hopping spread spectrum technology that was later adopted by the US Navy?

Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis (1893 –1972) was an Indian Bengali scientist and applied statistician. When he went to Cambridge his Mathematics tutor asked: “Have you met your wonderful countryman Ramanujan?”. Which college did he attend?

Dame Maria Matilda Ogilvie Gordon (1864-1939) was one of the first professional women in her field. In 1893 she obtained the London DSc, becoming the first woman to do so. In 1932 she was awarded the Lyell medal. What field did she primarily work in?
In a 1943 paper titled 'Autistic Disturbances of Affective Contact', who initially described infantile autism?

A statement attributed to Pierre-Simon Laplace expressed this man's influence on mathematics: "Read ____, read ____, he is the master of us all." Which 18th century mathematician, who went blind at the age of 60, does Laplace refer to?
After being injured in a car accident on July 2, 2006, which marine geologist and computational scientist became a quadriplegic?
From the Greek word meaning 'division of the Earth', what field of Earth science did Gladys Mae West, an African-American woman, make significant contributions to?
Marie Curie discovered which two elements?
Anandibai Joshee, Kei Okami, and Tabat Islambooly all were the first women from their respective countries to complete their studies in Western medicine in the US. Name their respective countries.
Mathematician Philippa Fawcett became the first woman to obtain the highest score, "above the Senior Wrangler", in which famous set of examinations.

Audrey Tang (born 1981) is a Taiwanese software programmer, in August 2016 she was invited to join the Taiwan Executive Yuan as a minister without portfolio, making her the first transgender official in the top executive cabinet. What programming language did she learn at age twelve?
KSOG, developed by Fritz Klein, stands for what measurement tool? It was first described in his 1978 book 'The Bisexual Option'.
"Black Man" a music track containing descriptions of a handful of black pioneers featured on which famous musician and songwriters 18th album.
'errofini' is an anagram for which well known book?
Nicola Rollock's 'Staying Power', a report on the experiences of black female professors, interviewed how many of the then 25 black female professors in the UK?
Which mathematician, an asylum seeker from Iran, won a fields medal in 2018?
Who is the only female mathematician that has won a Fields medal?
Which schizophrenic mathematician won the nobel prize for economics for game theory?
Which American professor innovated the initial designs for the ‘curved cattle chute’?
Edith Clarke was the first female professor of electrical engineering, what everyday item did she invent?

Dame Stephanie Shirley ran a software company called Freelance Programmers in the 1970s for female coders, working flexibly and from home. More than 290 out of 300 programming staff were female. But why did this come to an end?
column7: Introduction of the Sex Discrimination Act, passed in 1975 - she could no longer prioritise women in hiring. Today female employment in technical roles at major software companies is around 20%.

column6: Professor Laura Serrant OBE has been recognised as one of the most influential black people in the UK. What area of STEM does she work in?
column7: She is a Professor of Nursing (also accept community health/public health research)

column6: Who is the first African American selected for and to complete the first two phases of the US Air Force Aerospace Research Pilot School (ARPS), the training program for NASA astronaut selection?
For which space mission did Frances 'Poppy' Northcut, work as NASAs first female engineer to work in Mission control?
During the 1960s, while working the FDA, what medical drug did Dr. Frances Oldham refuse to approve in the US?
Who invented Kevlar?
What are the five criteria to assess newborn health of the Virginia Apgar's APGAR score?
Who was the first woman elected to the National Academy of Sciences? Her initials are the same as the post nominal title for a fellow of the royal society.
Fay Ajzenberg-Selove (1926-2012) was an American nuclear physicist. She was known for her experimental work in nuclear spectroscopy of what type of elements?

Born (1907) and educated in Vienna, Austria, this woman studied descriptive and projective geometry at the Technical University of Vienna. Her teachers included Moritz Schlick, from the Vienna Circle, and physicist Victor Weisskopf was a fellow student. Who are we referring to?
Who designed the experiment which vindicated Tsung-Dao Lee's and Chen-Ning Yang's prediction of the non-conservation of parity ? She won the first Wolf Prize in physics.

Who invented the first wheelchair lift? When he was six years old, doctors diagnosed him with muscular dystrophy. At the age of 15, he created a motorized wagon, called the Tri-Wheeler, with his father to help him get around.
Which African-American engineer was responsible for inventing interchangeable video game cartridges that revolutionised the gaming industry?

In a 1941 article in TIME magazine, who was referred to as the 'Black Leornado'? His accomplishments include pioneering new uses for Southern agricultural products and discovering 285 new uses for the peanut. He was a professor at the Tuskegee Institute.
Which African-American scientist invented the Laserphaco probe which improved cataract treatment and restored the eyesight of many patients?
Who was the first African-American woman in Space?
What is the name of the woman that the first immortalised cell line, Hela was named after?
Which African-American scientist pioneered a new treatment for Leprosy by extracting compounds from caulmoogra tree oil?
From taking a pocket watch apart to see how it worked, which black polymath invented America's first wooden clock that struck the hour? He also successfully predicted a solar eclipse in 1789.

Which British Chemist became the third women to win a Nobel Prize in Chemistry for her advancements in X ray crystallography, which led to the deciphering and confirmation of the crystal structures of cholesterol, penicillin, vitamin B12 and insulin?
How many women are science Nobel Prize laureates?
Which female scientist has won a nobel prize more than once?
90% of microphones are based on the invention of the electret microphone invented by G. M. Sessler and which black American inventor?

Which scientist discovered that insects can hear? He was born in 1867 to working-class parents in Cincinnati, Ohio, and became the first African-American to earn a doctorate in zoology from the University of Chicago.
Which LGBT scientist was the first american women in space?

Which scientist recently created an algorithm that eventually led to an image of a supermassive black hole at the heart of the Messier 87 galaxy, 55million light years from Earth, being captured for the first time?
Percy Julian, with Josef Pikl, was the first to synthesize physostigmine, an alkaloid that occurs naturally in what bean?
Marie Maynard Daly was a pioneer in the study of the effects of cholesterol and sugar on the heart and the first black woman in the US to earn a Ph.D. in which area of Science?
Caused by quantum effects on the event horizon, what is released by Black Holes?
A prize-winning biography titled “Black Apollo of Science: The Life of E___ E___ J___”, written by Kenneth R. Manning, is about which black scientist?
Which South Korean physicist holds the position of Professor in the Department of Physics and Centre for Plastic Electronics at Imperial College London. She recently won the Descarte's prize.
Which three colors make up the most common Trans pride flag?
"The Gendered Brain" was authored by whom?
Who was the only woman in the group that built the first atomic bomb for the Manhattan Project, and who later devised a way to use isotope ratios in tree rings to study climate change?
Svetlana Savitskaya became the second woman in ____, the first woman to fly to _____ twice, and the first woman to perform a ____walk. What is the missing word?
Joan Higginbotham, American engineer and astronaut, became the third black woman in space in which year? Note that in this year Germany hosted the FIFA world cup.
Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor is an orthopaedic surgeon and the first astronaut from which country in Asia?
James Pollack, American astrophysicist specialising in atmospheric science, was  a student of which famous physicist known for his book 'Cosmos'?
Which mathematician, teacher and writer appeared on University Challenge in 2017? Their first book, The Life-Changing Magic of Numbers, was published in 2019.
When is LGBT STEM day?

Edwin Hubble used which American woman astronomers luminosity–period relation, together with the galactic spectral shifts first measured by Vesto Slipher at Lowell Observatory, in order to establish that the universe is expanding?
Steve Silberman wrote which book that discusses autism?
column7: Neurotribes: The Legacy of Autism and the Future of Neurodiversity

column6: Yewande Biala manufactures vaccines for a living, and used to work 60 hours a week as an oncology vaccine specialist. What popular TV program has she been a part of?
Harriet Brooks (1876) was a Canadian physicist who discovered the recoil of what?
What is the name of Hannah Fry's latest book? The title is familiar among programmers.
In May 2019 Penguin Books published 'No one is too small to make a difference', which is a collection of speeches from which climate activist?
Which self-educated famous inventor had diabetes?

Which engineer, business magnate, and record-setting pilot suffered from OCD, chronic pain, and increasing deafness? He designed and then flew the worlds largest plane, which was dubbed the 'Spruce Goose'.
Sophia Brahe (1156-1643) assisted which astronomer with his astronomical observations?
Which Serbian physicist and mathematician was the first wife of Albert Einstein? Historians of science still debate their collaboration.
Who is the current Director-General of CERN?
What is the name of the first and only woman to win the prestigious Fields Medal, called the Nobel Prize of maths?
Which teenager discovered a novel method of inexpensively converting plastic waste into biofuel using a catalyst, called aluminosilicate?
Which mathematical institution launched the "Next Einstein Forum" in 2008, it is a programme to encourage investment in science research in Africa?
Which Brazilian mathematician became the first from Latin America to be awarded the Fields medal? It was in 2014, for his work on dynamical systems.
Which African-American mathematician published a series of successful almanacs in the 18th century? They contained calculation about the motion of the planets and stars.
Which mathematician and statistician was the first African-American to be inducted into the National Academy of Sciences? He worked on game theory and Bayesian statistics.
In 1990, Karen Uhlenbeck became the second woman to give a plenary speech at the International Congress of Mathematics. Who, in 1932, was the first?
Stephen Hawking first described this phenomenon. It relates to energy released by a black hole due to quantum effects. What is it called?
In 1925, who became the first African-American mathematician to be awarded a PhD? He graduated from Cornell.
Susan Brown is believed to have been the first female mathematics professor in the UK. She published many papers on triple-deck theory and boundary layers. What field of math did she work in?
Who invented the home pregnancy test?

Which Indian physicist was awarded the 1930 Nobel Prize in Physics for his pioneering work in light scattering and discovery of the Raman effect, making him the first Asian person and non-white person to win a Nobel Prize in Science?
What is the name of the Cuban epidemiologist famous for determining that yellow fever was transmitted to healthy humans by a mosquito?
Which Black British space scientist is a presenter on the BBC show "The Sky at Night"?

On what hit TV show does Dr Bernadette Rostenkowski-Wolowitz play a former waitress at the Cheesecake Factory, that completes a Ph.D in microbiology and lands a lucrative job at the pharmaceutical company, Zangen?
Which UK gender balance campaign's name is synonymous with the word 'learned'?
In 1898 Miller Reese Hutchison invented the 'Akouphone', what common name is given to this device today?

What was the name given to the fictional country, located in Sub-Saharan Africa, that was technologically advanced and the home of Marvel's 'Black Panther'? It first appeared in Fantastic Four #52 (1966).
The acronym ALS stands for which condition? Stephen Hawking lived with ALS for 55 years.
Speech generating devices (SGDs) have their roots in early electronic communication aids. The first such aid was a sip-and-puff typewriter prototyped in the 1960s, but in which country?
Geerat J. Vermeij is a Dutch-born professor at the University Of California at Davis of what field of science? He became blind at the age of three.

Farida Nana Efua Bedwei is a Ghanaian software engineer and cofounder of Logiciel, a fin-tech company in Ghana. She created a comic character called 'Karmzah' who gets her power from her crutches that she has to use for which disorder? Bedwei herself was diagnosed with it a year after her birth.

Earning the nicknames of "Forger of Thunderbolts" and "The Wizard of Schenectady", which German-American mathematician and physicist made significant advances in alternating current in America? He has a power equation named after him.

Which 2005 American drama film, directed by John Madden, starring Gwyneth Paltrow, Anthony Hopkins, and Jake Gyllenhaal depicts a brilliant mathematician whose genius was undone by crippling mental illness? Paltrow plays his daughter.
What is the name of Angela Saini's 2019 book which discusses race and science?
What year was Angela Saini's book inferior published?
Who is the author of the popular STEM book, Hello World: How to be Human in the Age of the Machine?
Which popular mathematician appeared on Channel 4's Countdown between 1982 and 2008?
The 2015 movie "The Man Who Knew Infinity" chronicles the life of which famous Indian mathematician?
In the 2019 Marvel film, Black Panther, what is the name of the technological genius who designs the vibranium Black panther suit for her brother?
The Indian-British-American structural engineer, Roma Agrawal is famous for her work on which well-known London skyscraper?
The Ramachandran plot, named after the Indian scientist Gopalasamudram Narayanan Ramachandran is used in Biochemistry to predict the structure of what type of macromolecule?
Marie Neurath, born Marie Reidemeister (1898 – 1986), was a member of the team that developed the Vienna Method of Pictorial Statistics, which she later renamed ISOTYPE. What does ISOTYPE stand for?
column7: International System of Typographic Picture Education

column6: How tall is the shard in meters?

In 2012, archaeologists examined skeletons found during the 19th Century. Analysis revealed one skeleton, named after the Eastbourne beauty spot where she was discovered, belonged to a woman of sub-Saharan African descent from around 125 AD. What was she named?
John Edmonstone, born into slavery in Guyana, was an expert in what field? His skills were instrumental in facilitating the pioneering scientific research of Charles Darwin.
Otis Boykin was an African-American Inventor and Engineer, best known for his work in the field of Electronics and his involvement in the improvement of what heart related device?
Simon Singh wrote which book that became the first mathematics book to become a Number One seller in the United Kingdom?
Angela Saini appeared on Christmas university challenge with which woman materials expert? She is the co-founder and director of the Institute of Making at UCL.
Defined on Google as 'a state formally cooperating with another for a military or other purpose', which word describes a person helping others to overcome barriers in STEMM?
What phrase describes a psychological pattern in which an individual doubts their accomplishments and has a persistent internalized fear of being exposed as a "fraud"?

In an interview with the BBC, David Lammy MP said "It's easy to say I'd like to see it scrapped," and "I'm comfortable with getting rid of it but the key question is what it would be replaced with?". What EDI term was he referring to?
Known for being reclusive, shy, and detached, which famous natural philosopher was conjectured to have Aspergers by Oliver Sacks? This well known scientist discovered hydrogen.
Who (born c. 350–370; died 415 AD) is considered the first woman mathematician? She lived in Alexandria, Egypt, then part of the Eastern Roman Empire.
Celia Grillo Borromeo was an Italian mathematician known for her discovery of the Clélie curve in 1728. This gives the formula for the curves that could be drawn on what rotating geometric object?

In number theory, a prime number p is a Sophie Germain prime if 2p + 1 is also prime. The number 2p + 1 associated with a Sophie Germain prime is called a safe prime. If 23 is a safe prime, what is its corresponding Sophie Germain prime?

Ada Lovelace's note G on the Analytical Engine from 1842 describes an algorithm for generating what numbers? These numbers are named after a famous Italian family of 17th and 18th century Swiss mathematicians.
Who was Marie Curie's PhD supervisor?
Who, with Otto Hahn and Otto Robert Frisch, co-discovered Nuclear Fission? Albert Einstein referred to her as the "German Marie Curie".
Who developed the first compiler, and was Director of the department that developed COBOL? She coined the term debugging, after a moth got stuck in relay.
Whose dissertation, completed in 1954, concluded that galaxies clumped together, rather than being randomly distributed throughout the universe?
In 2001, Lene Vestergaard Hau led a Harvard University team who, by use of a Bose-Einstein condensate, succeeded in completely stopping what?
Who was the first American woman in space?
In particle physics, Paul Dirac coined Bosons after which Calcutta born scientist? He worked on quantum mechanics and collaborated with Albert Einstein.

Alan L. Hart (October 4, 1890 – July 1, 1962) was one of the first trans men to undergo hysterectomy and gonadectomy in the United States, and lived the rest of his life as a man. He pioneered the use of which form of imaging in tuberculosis detection?

Sophia Jex-Blake, Isabel Thorne, Edith Pechey, Matilda Chaplin, Helen Evans, Mary Anderson, and Emily Bovell formed a group known as what? They became the first group of matriculated undergraduate female students at any British university.
In linguistics, what two word phrase is given to: the belief or impression that a word or language usage is of recent origin when it is long-established? The term was coined by Arnold Zwicky.

Christopher Gary Packham CBE is an English naturalist, nature photographer, television presenter and author, best known for his television work including what CBBC children's nature series (1986 to 1995)?
Kimberlé Williams Crenshaw coined what term that is now associated with a branch of feminism which identifies how different aspects of social and political discrimination overlap with gender?

Norbert Rillieux (1806-1894), widely considered to be one of the earliest chemical engineers, revolutionized the processing of what commodity? He did so with the invention of the multiple effect evaporator under vacuum.
How many science Nobel prizes have been awarded to black people?
In 1979 Sir William Arthur Lewis, from Saint Lucia, won the Nobel memorial prize for what science?
Hiranya V. Peiris is a British (Sri Lankan born) astrophysicist at University College London, best known for her work on what cosmological phenomenon? This phenomenon is evidence of the big bang.
Asha de Vos is a Sri Lankan marine biologist, ocean educator and pioneer of research of what marine mammal? This mammal is the largest to have ever existed.
The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind' is a 2019 British drama film written, directed by and starring which Black British actor?  He also starred in 12 years a slave.
Who is known for the discovery of C−H···O hydrogen bonds? She later worked with Kathleen Lonsdale on the characterisation and prevention of urinary calculi.

column3: Roger Bamkin of Women in Red
column6: Rosalind Franklin is one of our greatest and well known scientists. Can you estimate the number of photos of her that are free to use around the world?
Queen Victoria honoured Kate Marsden who travelled from the UK to Siberia by sledge to find a cure for leprosy.  Why wasn't she allowed to attend the opening of Bexhill museum which she founded?
Jean Purdy, with Robert Edwards and Andrew Steptoe, developed what process?
Newnham College for women opened in Cambridge in 1871. How many years was it before their students could obtain a University of Cambridge degree?
Alhazen (c.965-1038) was an Egyptian physicist who made major advances in optics. He rejected the older idea that light was emitted from what human organ?
Al-Khwarizmi (c.800 - 850) discovered what area of mathematics?
Al-Khwarizmi's solution is a general method for finding the two roots of a quadratic equation: a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0. In terms of a, b, and c what are these roots?
Elizabeth Garrett Anderson (1836-1917) was the first woman in Britain to qualify in what field of science?
Elizabeth Garrett Anderson (1836-1917) was mayor of which English town on the North Sea coast in the county of Suffolk? She was the first woman mayor in England.
Who first discovered the skeletons of the dinosaurs 'Plesiosaurus' and 'Pterodactylus macronyx'?
Agnes Arber (1879-1960) spent 50 years researching the anatomy and morphology of monocotyledonous plants.  What are monocotyledonous plants?
column7: Seeds typically contain only one embryonic leaf, or cotyledon

column6: Charlotte Auerbach, a German-British geneticist discovered what process? This process changes the genetic information of an organism.
Laura Bassi (Maria Catarina) was an Italian physicist and the first female professor, at any university, of what science?
Ruth Benedict (1887-1948) was a US anthropologist who produced 'The Chrysanthemum and the Sword' (1946), an account of the culture of which East Asian country?
What was named after Mary Adela Blagg, a British amateur astronomer, who prepared the 'Named Lunar Formations' with Karl Muller?
Between 1902-03, in a letter to Rutherford, Harriet Brooks refers to the radioactivity of radon-220 decreasing to one-half of its value in about a minute. In 6 minutes what fraction remains?
In 2012, the Royal Society of Chemistry held a competition calling for papers offering explanations to the Mpemba effect. What is the effect?
column7: The Mpemba effect is a process in which hot water can freeze faster than cold water.

column6: One feature of Mitochondrial DNA is that it is only inherited through the female line. What name is given to the single common ancestor who lived nearly 200,000 years ago?
Katherine McAlpine wrote the lyrics of which song performed at the inauguration of CERN in 2008?
Margaret Cavendish was formerly maid of honour to which 17th century Queen? Cavendish accompanied this queen into exile in Paris in 1644.
Aganice of Thessaly was an ancient Greek (2nd or 1st century BC) astronomer who was known for predicting the dissapearance of what?

"Did you know that ___ proposed a heliocentric universe 300 years before Copernicus? That she wrote of universal gravitation 500 years before Newton? But who would listen to her? She was just a nun, a woman." These lines from a poem by Siv Cedering describe who?
Which clinic, based in Cambridgeshire, ignored Jean Purdy's scientific contributions for over 30 years?
